speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I got your message about the wine club, Friday night, and yes, I will be there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good, Dad's kicking me out of the house that night so he and Sherry can have a little party. [_laughs_] Oh, I don't know. Life really is a circle, isn't it?  I'm letting Dad use my place for his friends to get together, and just a few years ago it would have been Dad who'd have to leave his house for my parties.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, if you'd had any parties when we were young that would be filled with irony!

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank goodness you're here, I've got some rather shocking news.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Daphne
text: I found a ring in your father's underwear drawer.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shocked_] What on earth would leave a ring around his underwear drawer?

speaker: Daphne
text: Not around, in!  An engagement ring in a jewelry box.

speaker: Niles
text: An engagement ring?  Dad must be about to ask Sherry to marry him.  Do you know what that means?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we're going to hear what Mendelssohn's "Wedding March" sounds like on [_in horror_] the banjo!

speaker: Niles
text: It means she's going to be our mother.  What are we going to do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's nothing we can do, Niles.  It's what Dad wants.

speaker: Niles
text: But... what do we even call her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose she'll want us to call her "mother."  No, that's too formal.  "Mama"... no, "Ma!"

speaker: Niles
text: [_in dread_] Ooh, better still.  "Don't you look nice, Ma." "Yes, I'd love another corn dog, Ma."  "Off to the roller derby, _Ma'_?"

speaker: Daphne
text: That's typical of you two.  Your father is about to get married and all you two can think about is how it will affect you. [_pause_] What about me?!

speaker: Frasier
text: What about you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sherry's never exactly liked me.  You don't think she'll try to make your father get rid of me, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, of course not.  He'd be lost without you.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and even if by some chance that were to happen, Daphne, I could always use you. [_realizing innuendo_] I, I would know of a position you could take... [_digging into a hole_] ...services that you could perform. [_holds himself, then:_] I would know of an opening... [_realizes the path he has taken and takes up the check_] This is on me.  _Daphne nods at him in confusion.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Niles and Frasier are sat on the sofa as Sherry and Martin prepare for their party._

speaker: Sherry
text: Marty, you need to stir the dip more, it's got whole lumps of soup mix in it.

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: My, my, my, quite a little shindig you two are planning for tonight.  We have the cheese logs, the erotic fortune cookies. For after dinner, a bloopers tape: "Too Hot For Hee-Haw."

speaker: Niles
text: I see that Martha Stewart party book I gave you really paid off.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, this old crowd, they wouldn't go for that fru-fru stuff. Get 'em liquored up, put out some corn nuts and they can go all night.

speaker: Frasier
text: When you say all night-?

speaker: Martin
text: [_finishes stirring_] There you go, smooth as silk.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_kisses him_] Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Who's going to be attending this soiree?

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, just some old friends I'm dying for Marty to meet.  Now, let's see, there's Ray and Lola Sherwood - well, I worked with them in Atlantic City when they had a knife-throwing act.  Oh, now, Marty, try not to stare at her eyes, she gets self-conscious.  And, let's see.  Oh, and Edith's coming with her new fiance.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, she finally met him, huh?

speaker: Sherry
text: Mm, just this week.

speaker: Niles
text: They're engaged and they just met this weekend?

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, you see, up until now, it's been kind of a pen-pal relationship.  He's been... detained the last few years.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, you're going to need some room for those corn nuts, why don't I just get this pesky priceless sculpture out of your way!   [_N.B. Since the Chihuly is a genuine work of art, valued at upwards of $75,000, it is always removed from the set before any scene that involves rough-housing in the living room._]

speaker: Sherry
text: Marty, I never heard back from Vic and Linda, did you get a message?

speaker: Martin
text: No.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, gee, maybe they left one on my machine.

speaker: Martin
text: So, what are you guys up to tonight? _Niles has just read one of the fortune cookies, and is gaping when he suddenly realizes Martin's question._

speaker: Niles
text: Em, our wine club is having a vertical tasting at the "Opus One."

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, don't drink too much.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs_] It's not like that, Dad, you don't actually drink the wine.  You just swish it around and spit it out.

speaker: Martin
text: We all did that at Duke's New Year's Eve party.  Of course, it wasn't wine, it was egg salad!

speaker: Sherry
text: You know, that is so weird.  I just got a message from my manager down at McGinty's.  Some guy came in asking a lot of questions about me.

speaker: Martin
text: What kind of questions?

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, like where I used to work, the people I used to date, and the weirdest part is, my neighbor told me somebody came around asking her about me too.

speaker: Martin
text: Sounds like somebody's checking up on ya'.

speaker: Sherry
text: Like a detective?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, it's probably a credit card company, something like that, I wouldn't worry about it. _Martin gets up from the table and casually walks toward Frasier and Niles, as Sherry goes into the kitchen._

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, still, it is a little scary.  I wish I knew who it was.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, forget about it, I've been through this before.  Private investigators never leave a trail.  Really, it could be anyone.

speaker: Sherry
text: If you think so.

speaker: Martin
text: [_whispering furiously_] Which one of you hired him?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that is just crazy!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, who else would have the money to do something like that?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no idea, we have nothing to do with it.  Do you really think that we would hire someone to spy on Sherry?  My God, I'm insulted!

speaker: Niles
text: As am I!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, all right.  Maybe I was jumping to the wrong conclusion.

speaker: Frasier
text: You most certainly have!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry, boys.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Just forget about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering furiously_] You hired a detective, how could you?!

speaker: Niles
text: I have never been so insul-!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, I'm sorry.  I was just looking out for Dad here. I mean, what do we really know about this woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: She makes Dad happy, that's all we need to know.

speaker: Niles
text: Is it?  Some people do get married before they know all they should.  Remember Cousin Donald?  He was married two years before he found out his wife used to be a man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Cousin Donald is a very rare case.  First, most people don't have a hidden past; and second, most people have a better eye for details than Cousin Donald.  For God's sake, the woman could pick up a watermelon with one hand!

speaker: Niles
text: I was just simply trying to get some background information.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, stop it.  Call it off right now, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Consider it done.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Niles
text: We gotta run.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah. [_shouts through_] Goodbye.

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s_] Bye, boys.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_o.s_] Have a nice time you two, we'll save you some cake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_to Niles_] You see that, how sweet she is? My God, I can't believe you're actually having that woman investigated.  You know, try to have a little trust in people!  _Frasier quickly takes one of his precious African art sculptures from the table and into his jacket for safety before leaving with Niles.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa. Roz enters as she meets Frasier.  Niles is sat on a front table discussing matters with a detective._

speaker: Roz
text: You see someone following me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you can play along now.  _A female police officer enters as Roz and Frasier sit.  The officer has a rather large stomach._

speaker: Police
text: Ah, excuse me, ma'am, I saw you cross against the light. I'm going to have to write you a ticket.

speaker: Roz
text: [_winded voice_] Oh, well, I'm really sorry about that.  It's just that it's so cold out there and the pollution, I just didn't want to expose my unborn child to the elements any longer than I needed to. [_Roz stands revealing her bump_]

speaker: Police
text: You're pregnant?  Well, I know a little bit about that myself.

speaker: Roz
text: Then you know exactly what I'm talking about.  Society doesn't go easy on pregnant ladies, does it? [_pats officer's "bump"_] So, when are you due?

speaker: Police
text: I'm not pregnant!

speaker: Roz
text: [_submitting_] That's Roz Doyle.

speaker: Police
text: Would you step over here?

speaker: Roz
text: R-O-Z.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, hello, Frasier.  May I borrow your pen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly. [_hands it over as he shakes the detective's hand_] How do you do?

speaker: Niles
text: [_writes check_] I appreciate all your hard work and I am sorry to have to break off the investigation in the middle.

speaker: Detective
text: That's all right, people change their minds all the time.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sure they do. [_hands it over_] There you are.

speaker: Detective
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: There now, don't you feel better?

speaker: Niles
text: I suppose so.

speaker: Frasier
text: You have to admit, I was right on this one.  There was absolutely no justification for giving into your baser instincts of prying in Sherry's past.

speaker: Detective
text: I almost forgot.  I wrote up a little report on what I found out so far.  That's one interesting lady.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I should have just told him to drop that in the trash. After all, we're concerned with Dad's happiness.  Sometimes, Frasier, you are like the beacon piercing the fog of my baser instincts. [_to waitress_] Excuse me, would you just drop that in the...

speaker: Frasier
text: I see your point. [_opens the envelope_] I hate myself for what I'm doing.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, we're doing it for Dad's own good.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reads document_] Oh, so far, so good: graduated from high school; almost paid off her Subaru; you know she's been married.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, she mentioned that, to Johnny Dempsey.

speaker: Frasier
text: There were two others.  Ned Foley, Mark Wallace...

speaker: Niles
text: That's a bit troubling, three previous marriages.

speaker: Frasier
text: ...Vincent Mayhew, Guiltham Mandel, Waltz...

speaker: Niles
text: Just give me the total!

speaker: Frasier
text: Six that we know of.  God, you had to go and fire that detective before he finishes reporting!

speaker: Niles
text: Six? [_reads them_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, she's obviously incapable of remaining in a relationship. That doesn't bode well for the marriage, does it?

speaker: Niles
text: And on the other hand, it does bode well for Dad getting a "yes" when he proposes.  He has a right to know about this.

speaker: Frasier
text: But we already told him we weren't involved in the investigation, we can't just tell him now we were lying!

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe there's some way to impart the information without explaining how we came by it.  You know, just sort of drop it casually in the conversation.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how would that go? [_deadpan:_] Oh, Dad, you going to the Sherry Ex-Husband Convention this year?  Besides that, you know, Dad may know everything already.

speaker: Niles
text: I think we need to find that out.  How would we feel if we let Dad marry this woman, and in a year's time he's tossed aside like Danny Mitchell.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who's that?

speaker: Niles
text: Page five, engaged but never married.  _FADE OUT  End of Act One  Act Two  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne and Niles are sat on the couch whilst Frasier is standing as Martin walks in wearing his best clothes from his room._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, boys. [_they greet him_] Daph', what do you think about this jacket?  I don't know, it just - something doesn't quite feel right.

speaker: Daphne
text: I think it's nice.

speaker: Martin
text: Really?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, I was talking with a lady today down at the cafe and I happened to mention that I'd been married twice before, and a look clouded over her face as if I'd confessed to some unspeakable sin!

speaker: Niles
text: Makes you wonder what people go through who've been married even more times than that.  Quite a taboo they face.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I don't know, some...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, I think it harkens back to the puritanical streak that still runs through this country.  What do you think?

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters_] There's a yakkety-yak streak that runs through this family.  Maybe, it's the shirt, do you like this shirt?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, it's nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: That'd make a good topic to discuss on my show.  Niles, you know the hurdles that are faced by people with multiple marriages.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course, the hard part would be rounding up enough people who've been married a significant number of times.  Do you know anyone?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I don't.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, Mrs. Krabs upstairs-

speaker: Frasier
text: How about you, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, sure, I know some people.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  You do.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I think.

speaker: Niles
text: You think.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, maybe I do, maybe I don't, who cares?  I hate this shirt, I better go change this shirt!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was fruitless!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll tell you one thing I'm sure of. _Daphne stares into space as Frasier and Niles look at her inquisitively._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm allowed to talk now, am I? [_pause_] I've never seen your father so nervous.  He's meeting Sherry at McGinty's, I bet he's planning to pop the question.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's it Frasier, we're just going to tell him what we found out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but we still don't know what he knows.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't you think if she had told him she had been married six times, then he would remember?

speaker: Daphne
text: Who, Sherry?

speaker: Martin
text: You know, maybe this shirt isn't so bad.  Especially with this new jacket.  What do you think of this new jacket?

speaker: Daphne
text: I think it's nice.  Sherry's been married six times?

speaker: Martin
text: Who told you that?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_realizing her mistake_] They did. [_points to brothers_]

speaker: Martin
text: What's this all about?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, I'd love to see that first shirt with the second jacket.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on.  You got this from the investigator - you did hire him, didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I guess there's no use denying it.  Yes, yes, we did hire him.  Although the word "we" is not entirely accurate.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I am shocked...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shut up, Niles!  Look, Dad, we were just concerned about you.  We know about the engagement ring.

speaker: Martin
text: My ring?  Which one of you went through my drawers?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right now, pointing fingers is not going to do us any good.

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell is the matter with you two?

speaker: Frasier
text: She did it! [_points to Daphne_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's nice to know there isn't a single person in this house I can trust.  Sherry told me about her marriages the first week of our dating!  I didn't tell you because it's none of your damn business, just like it's none of your damn business who I marry or who I don't marry!  I don't know why I'm even wasting my time talking to you!

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you see what I get for confiding in you two blabbermouths! The next time I find something interesting in your father's underwear drawer, I'm just gonna sit on it!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, this evening is an entire disaster.  I'm already late for dinner with Maris.  I just don't know how this could have happened. [_goes to door but doesn't open it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, who'd have guessed that something so innocent as spying on a man's girlfriend and rifling his underwear drawer can turn so ugly!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there is one consolation.  We told Dad the truth and we were able to bear his anger.  That's the nice thing about our relationship, we're all adults.  We can talk things through, we're not afraid of confrontation...

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop stalling, Niles!  Dad must be on the elevator by now!  _Niles checks through the spy-hole, nods in confirmation and exits as Daphne enters._

speaker: Daphne
text: Look what I found in your father's jacket.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do not want to know about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: He forgot the ring!  This is going to be embarrassing for him. I suppose I could take it down to him.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes ring_] No, no, Daphne.  I should do that.  It will give me an excellent opportunity to show him just how happy I am that he's marrying Sherry.

speaker: Daphne
text: That would be very nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I just can't figure out why he would propose in a place like McGinty's!  It seems like such a shabby setting. [_looks at ring_] Well, I guess he was just trying to match the ring.  _Frasier exits.  FADE OUT_  **GIVE ME A RING SOMETIME**  _Scene Two - McGinty's. Sherry and Martin are sat on the front table chatting._

speaker: Sherry
text: So I told her that you and I would take a trip up there this spring. [_Martin is quiet_] Well, you like my sister, right?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, now, come on, Mart'.  You can't hold one little embarrassing moment against her.  She didn't know you were in there!

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, I don't.  I like your sister.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, then what is wrong with you?  You're being so quiet.

speaker: Martin
text: I got something on my mind.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, what is it?

speaker: Martin
text: I've been thinking a lot about us and... where do you see us going?

speaker: Sherry
text: Gee, I don't know.  I mean, I'm having fun the way things are. You have your life, I have mine.  No pressure.

speaker: Martin
text: That's what I thought you'd say.

speaker: Sherry
text: There's nothing wrong with us just having fun.

speaker: Martin
text: No.  It's just that we've been just having fun for a long time now.  Let me ask you something, where do you see us in a year? Five years?

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, gee, I don't know, I try not to look too far ahead.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess that's the difference between us.  Because I can't stop thinking that far ahead.  You know, I've come to realize, Sherry, that I want to get married again.  And you know it's not anything you're interested in.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, can you blame me?  I mean, Marty you know my track record, I've been down that road a lot of times!  I mean, I've learned the hard way, I'm not looking for forever.

speaker: Martin
text: I am.

speaker: Sherry
text: So... so you're breaking up with me?

speaker: Martin
text: We're just looking for different things, Sherry.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: It's hot in here.

speaker: Sherry
text: Yeah.  _Martin takes out a handkerchief and brings it to his forehead, but he drops it on the floor.  Martin goes down to the floor to pick it up.  Frasier sees him from the door and it looks like he is getting down on bended knee to propose.  Frasier runs in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm glad I've seen you.

speaker: Martin
text: Get out of here. [_sits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, I've got something that I think you might like to have before you tell Sherry whatever it is you want to tell her.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, he's already told me.

speaker: Frasier
text: He has?  Well, that is just wonderful and may I say, it's about time!  I couldn't be happier for you.

speaker: Sherry
text: That's nice to know.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd like you to know that everybody is one hundred percent behind this decision - my God, we're all so excited.

speaker: Martin
text: FRASIER!

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, I'm so glad that you're so happy your father's breaking up with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizes_] Breaking up? [_pause_] I had no idea.

speaker: Sherry
text: And you get paid to help people through their difficult moments?  _Frasier exits in embarrassment.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - McGinty's. Time has lapsed. Sherry and Martin are at the door bidding their farewells._

speaker: Martin
text: It isn't easy to say goodbye, is it?

speaker: Sherry
text: No.  It doesn't get any easier either, I should know.  Listen, Marty, this is usually the time people say, "Well, let's be friends" and then, oh, there's a phone call or two but they never see each other again and, well, I just want you to know I am around for you if you ever get lonely or you just need to talk.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks. [_they hug_]

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, and when you call, if a man answers - hang up.  _Martin laughs with her as she leaves.  Martin goes to the bar and stares up at the game on the television whilst contemplating life without Sherry.  Frasier enters and sits with him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.  The only reason I came down here was to bring you this. [_hands over ring_] Obviously I made another colossal blunder in a week full of them.  I'm really sorry, Dad. [_Martin is silent_] I guess you don't really feel like talking.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, Frasier, sometimes I just feel like sitting here and watching the game, all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, I can do that.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure. [_looks up_] So the, er, Sonics and the, er, Bulls.  That Jordan, he's really something, huh?  Yeah.  The way he scores those points and gets the ball back when the other team misses... Wow!  That's incredible.  He made the same impossible shot twice in a row!

speaker: Martin
text: It's the instant replay. [_pause, looks at ring_] You know, I was carrying this thing around for a month.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but at the end of every night I just couldn't pop the question, and then I realized I knew what the answer would be.  She didn't want to get married again.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's all right.  Maybe it wouldn't have worked out between us anyway.  Your mom's a hard act to follow!  I never went through anything like this with her.  We knew we were meant to be together and that was that.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hard to find that out, Dad.  I've been trying for a while.

speaker: Martin
text: [_pats him on the shoulder_] You'll get there.  I hope we both do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, in time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was quite a shot!

speaker: Martin
text: Patton's been pretty hot lately.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's the score here, anyway?

speaker: Martin
text: Sonics are only down by five, they've still got a chance if they can hold Jordan.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to waiter_] Can I have a beer here, please?

speaker: Martin
text: [_to waiter_] Yeah, make that two.  _Frasier looks at his father in mutual respect.  End of Act Two_
